39047606.review: Loved this game a lot! the puzzles were fun and unique plus lots of fun extras you can do. Story was cute and I enjoyed it. The map was my only issue it didn't have a zoom out option but that may been just to add more of a challange! I planing on playing it a second time!

38641491.review: Pocket Kingdom is a great underrated puzzlevania platformer, which reminds me of a mini-Fez. This is straight puzzle platforming - if you're wanting to shoot baddies, look elsewhere.  The normal story room puzzles seem to have just the right difficulty for the most part. They aren't easy, but other than one time where I didn't realize that I could perform a specific task, I found they usually could be solved without finding a guide.  The 'extra' puzzles (not required to finish the game) were much more challenging, and honestly I can't imagine most people finding these without getting outside help. This (and the awkward map) are probably my only complaints of the game - it would have been nice if some of the NPC's gave subtle hints for where to find some of super-hidden stuff.  Overall though, these are small nitpicks and Pocket Kingdom is a thumbs up.

38556163.review:
Fun puzzles of mostly middling difficulty. Nice atmosphere and lovely artwork. Not too much music, but what's there is nice. A serious lack of sound effect. Linear mostly, but still engrossing.

A very fun, little puzzle game.

This game is a steal. Don't think, just buy.

32610820.review: A surprisingly deep and challenging puzzle game wrapped in one of my favorite pixel art aesthetics to come out in the last few years. Beyond some minor issues (dialogue translation/redundancies, an error on the map, the map being a little too much information from the beginning) there's not much I can say that should deter anyone who is a fan of puzzlers. I had more difficulty than I would've expected in a couple rooms and have gotten more replay value than I would have expected from trying to collect all the items/diary entries and seeing what alternate solutions I could find for some of the rooms.

IL METROIDVANIA CHE NON TI ASPETTI (Pocket Kingdom)
I metroidvania stanno vivendo una seconda giovinezza sul mercato PC. Pocket Kingdom è un ottimo esempio di questo trend. Originale, semplice e curato è stata una piacevole sorpresa anche se proprio per la sua originalità dobbiamo più parlare di puzzlevania che di metroidvania.

29930443.review:
In this review I will be discussing the indie puzzle adventure game Pocket Kingdom which was released December 8th of 2016. Pocket Kingdom is developed by 08 Games and published by Plug In Digital, and WhisperGames.

In Pocket Kingdom you play as the pilot on a hot air balloon. While flying through the air searching for the floating islands, you stumble upon a hidden city amongst the clouds—where you crash land. After crashing you meet with locals who leave hints as to the location of your crashed zeppelin and give you clues about the divine secrets and mysteries of the “Pocket Kingdom” along with other useful bits of information. From here the game takes off and it’s up to the player to solve puzzles, explore the many different side scrolling levels and find the keys and other items to open doors and progress further. Another thing to note is that talking to most (if not all) of the NPCs is highly helpful as many of them have something to say about either the storyline, where to go, your crash location and even tips on how to traverse puzzles. The only thing that was a bit off-putting about this type of talk to everyone, explore everything playstyle was that at times I felt a bit lost, or unsure of where I was to go or who was who and what was where. This isn’t so much the case when it comes to the mechanics of the game itself. There are sign posts throughout the game’s levels which offer bits of helpful information and help the player understand how to use tools and other items. However, I would note that as a player, if you feel lost at the beginning of the game, that’s quite normal given the amount of lore the game throws at you right off the bat. If that’s the case, I would suggest that you continue playing and pay attention to the NPCs dialogue as it can be very helpful in understanding where you are and where you need to go next.

For the full review go here - http://www.gamingcypher.com/pocket-kingdom-review-pc/

- интересный мир и диалоги NPС

- пасхалки про омскую птицу и мыльного дрейка прямиком из 2011
Итог:
- рекомендую тем, кто хочет поаутировать

29194059.review:
Pocket Kingdom is a rich and wonderful puzzle game that is an amazing example of progression in game design. What attracted me to this title were two things; one believe it or not, was the Steam suggestion tab. In a rare lightning in a bottle moment the suggestion system actually worked. Secondly was the wonderful art from the screenshots. I knew I had to get my hands on this game and I am glad to say that I didn't regret it.

The setting for Pocket Kingdom is of the steampunk variety with a big dollop of magic. You are a down on his luck adventurer who takes on a job to find a mystical floating island and take a picture of the slumbering god that inhabits it. Needless to say, easier said than done. You get shot down by pirates, thus begins the adventure. While the themes are very familiar in Pocket Kingdom the entire lore is original and at times a bit odd. The reason for that is that Pocket Kingdom does not hold your hand much in this game.

From a lore standpoint the game acts like its lore is all common knowledge, there are names thrown around and you feel like you are always trying to catch up to what is going on. It's not a gripe necessarily, but I do feel that to fully grasp every single detail of the story, that it might benefit from playing the game twice.

Now there are signs to tell you what buttons do what and occasionally a use this tool here type of thing, but you do feel very much bewildered when the game starts. I didn't mind this to be honest and I felt like I was on an adventure in a strange world.

Upon heading up the cliffs after your "landing" you soon discover that you are not the first and surely won't be the last to land on this island. There are several districts all brimming with their own people, factions, and lore to digest.

The inhabitants tell you the basic rules of what they have learned to call, "Pocket Kingdom." Doors and ladders are the only means of traversing from area to area, as physics is warped and walking left might just leave you all the way on the right.

Additionally, the god of the island is a trickster and puzzles are springing up all over the island.

Lastly, escape is nigh on impossible and you're out of luck!

Those rules are very important as you begin taking on the various puzzles the island has to offer. The game is played from a classic side-view and the basic goal is to explore, find useful gear, and get off the bloody island. Also, if at all possible, snag a picture of this supposed God.

How you go about this is completely on you, this is a game you will beat at your own pace. I absolutely loved the progression in Pocket Kingdom, the puzzles get harder and harder but never did I once feel overwhelmed.

The puzzles involve boxes, levers, and lasers. Things get tricky though when you begin throwing in grappling hooks, rocket launchers, and gravity pads begin to appear. Remember I said physics is warped? Yeah you can fall and land on top of the screen. It definitely takes some time to wrap your head around and makes puzzles dynamic as hell. I applaud the puzzle design as I couldn't imagine how the developer came up with such clever ways of using a simple concept.

When it comes to difficulty, there is going to be plenty of trial and error, no puzzle will stop you but some will take longer for you to figure out. Experimentation is key here but it never got tiresome for me. Also there is plenty of that "AHA" feeling when you get things working the way you want. It's very satisfying.

There is an over-world map that you can traverse that is riddled with secrets, passages, treasure, and easter-eggs. Progression is handled beautifully here as well, as you gain access to different parts of the island bit by bit. Going about finding all the rooms on the island is quite a task. Attention to detail is important and exploration is usually rewarded.

As a reviewer, my tip to you would be generally if you are looking to get somewhere that chances are there is a passage nearby.

Along the way you will collect gear that will help you navigate the island and make getting around less of a grind.

The aesthetics are strange but in good ways. The area that I felt was the weakest was the Sprite design, as you run into many characters that all look the same. However, the areas themselves are magically archaic, feeling old but brimming with an unseen life. Certain areas have a great amount of detail to them and look wonderfully rustic. Each area has generally its own theme and all of them are well done. My favorite is easily the Abandoned Temple, with the Pirates coming in a close second.

Overall I was very impressed with the game itself, it's designed very well. There are some gripes here though, the UI is particularly wonky, at one point getting locked on the reset progress screen, much to my terror.

Using the Steam overlay caused a few graphical errors where my character was in a place he actually wasn't. Nothing restarting the game didn't fix but enough to note.

The music/sound in the game was on par, but did get a bit grating on the ears sometimes. The music tends to repeat itself.  Not a huge complaint and honestly this will vary depending on personal taste. The game does feature Steam Cards/Achievements, and happily does have full controller support.

From a replay aspect, that is up to how much you care to fully understand the world of Pocket Kingdom. You could just get all the secrets and discover all the rooms and call it a day. That took me about six hours in total. I imagine a second play through would take significantly less.

Pocket Kingdom is a satisfying game in all regards. I am honestly very happy I discovered this game and greatly recommend it. You have seen games like this before so while not on high on the charts for innovation, if you loved games like Escape Goat or Blackhole then you should check out this game. It's fun, relaxing, and I loved the great puzzle design.

At the ridiculously low price of $6.99/£4.99 this is guaranteed to pay for itself in enjoyment.

Oh, and a nod for the people who have played it; Room 74 is impossible to find.

28428222.review:
A seriously underrated game! Pocket Kingdom is a slow paced puzzle game with an interesting story, containing a few hours of singleplayer gameplay. If you liked FEZ and Cave Story, the game has a similar world building vibe. The game's charming soundtrack also reminds me of these two games, plus Minecraft and Final Fantasy series.

For such low price, it's an absolute gem!

28390273.review:
Great puzzle+*vania game, revisiting the push-pull block with gravity and distance elements (you can push distant blocks with rockets, you can pull nearby blocks with a hook). Add lasers and you get a complex puzzle game - meaning that you have to think quite a lot, while not too complicated (all puzzles can be solved without a guide).

Great value.

28351282.review:
It took me 3 hours to get to one of the endings. 6 hours to discover most secrets (still 2 achievements to get though). I'm very satisfied with this puzzle game (someone called it puzzlevania and I like that term). I think that it really doesn't need to be any longer.

Good and atmospheric pixelart and music, though Amiga (or Adlib) music style would fit the graphics better than NES/Gameboy-style.

The dialogues are sometimes tl;dr, but they're skippable and the keywords are highlighted, so you know what's needed even if you don't intend to read all of the text.

The only really negative thing is that you can sometimes block your exit so you can't return to the area normally (because you either die or climb back on the ladder). Not a game breaking issue, as you can reset the area or teleport to somewhere else, but still, could be avoided.

Overall, good game, just buy it.

28328065.review:
这是一个剧情上具有神秘感，取得关键物品需要把各种要素不断组合排列达到过关目的的像素游戏。上手难度还算适中，从多角度考虑并尝试还算可以正常游玩，暂时没有卡关。适合喜欢烧脑解谜类游戏的玩家。

优点：
游戏节奏适当，剧情与解谜结合，流程上不让人觉得烦躁。
音乐还行，有神秘感，符合故事背景。
能使用的武器需要多加思考用法，解谜过程不算枯燥。
有中文翻译，功能解说也算到位，不然游戏进展会比较慢。
很方便的传送门功能，如果没有的话，恐怕很难坚持玩下去。

缺点：
游戏贴图不够精细，全屏6倍显示模式，玩半个小时以上眼睛就开始累了，可能是激光的关系？而且贴图不够精细会干扰对道具和背景的判断。
既然是要拍摄魔神的照片，如果拍的是像素化的，那么知名报社给的报酬和玩家所获得的成就感也会降低吧~

建议：
虽然是像素游戏，但是还可以优化游戏贴图，降低游玩的视觉疲劳。

28326796.review: （此游戏并不是NOKIA N-GAGE上的同名游戏，同时这游戏和世嘉的NN游戏并非一个游戏）还算不错的推箱子游戏，风格很不错，感觉有点银河城的感觉，音乐超级棒，整个流程不是太费脑子，重要的是支持中文，而且这汉化也不赖，看着还是要比一般的休闲游戏好不少的，还是值得购买来玩玩的。10分给这游戏8分，主要还是不满强制爬梯得设定（手柄的摇杆如果突然抽风就直接爬上去了）以及竖直降落（虽说能完成跑男<笑称，实际是下落的人>成就，如果是一般的那种休闲游戏我还是能接受，没这两设定我给9.4分）的设定（这游戏其实还特别爱玩梗，比如toad蘑菇头不让你去见碧琪公主，水管工马里奥要修水管，天朝口头禅什么鬼之类的都有）-另外这游戏的评测被某人清一色的点了个踩，最后我想说脑子是个好东西，希望你（某个点踩人）能有。----这游戏超棒的音乐也放在目录下可找到

/////////////////////12.12.2016//////////////////多玩一段时间后再追评  
疯狂玩梗 帮超级玛丽修水管，翻译很接地气，连这是什么鬼都翻译出来了，2333.
游戏很好玩，背景音乐很好听,关卡还比较有难度的（相比于存推箱子，加入了其他元素，比如不同性质的箱子，重力翻转，传送门等等）要费些脑力，武器（导弹发射器，抓钩，貌似一大推）
缺点：像素颗粒太大了，游戏整体体验还没什么，地图里面显示的缩略图直接完全不知道是一坨什么。。。。
ps：请尽量先攒到3个金币，然后去西边的转送门恶魔那里，剧情会让你去买红色的恶魔钥匙，把钥匙给恶魔会开启三个传送门，三个传送门的关卡通过，就可以去神庙二层(解锁传送功能！解锁传送功能！解锁传送功能！重要的事情说三遍，不然跑路会累的要死)
9/10 瑕不掩瑜，绝对是值得玩游戏

Интересные головоломки, которые часто заставляют задуматься. Довольно завлекающий мир. И всё это складывается в одно большое "Очаровательно".

28308000.review:
Привет!                                                                                                                                                                                                          Меня зовут Саша Зенько. Я из Беларуси. 
Я делаю хардкорные letsplay видео, где я прохожу клавиатурные игры без рук (использую только мой подбородок и мышку). 
У меня есть программа, которая считывает движения мыши, и переводит их в клавиатуру.
И я записал видео как я играю в вашу игру)
Летсплей смотрите здесь:
https://youtu.be/Am8GOvAuHTY

28304708.review:
Excelent game, art, music and gameplay is very well made. Tavern music is my favorite :D

Puzzles are very fun to solve, navigating through the world is very accesible there's not a moment where you dread having to go back to a previous area, story is very warm and inviting as well as the NPCs, very good game to get you in a cozy mood.

10/10 definitely.

28301300.review:
推箱子+银河战士恶魔城
老实说我在入手之前没想到这游戏这么会玩。
虽然基础规则是推箱子，但跟重力和激光等要素结合起来丰富多彩，加上自由探索解密起来简直是要上天。

优点：
核心玩法烧脑，但游戏节奏却比较休闲
优秀像素风美术和8bit音乐
脑洞大开的世界设定和剧情
马里奥以及其他梗（去看社区某张中文截图你们就懂了）

缺点：
有些关卡太难，但对核心玩家来说，要的就是这个味！

28300109.review: Puzzlevania is the best description for the type of game this is. The puzzles are honestly tricky and require retries and some trial and error. Someone said the game is 3-4 hours, but I think it's going to take me longer since I'm not as clever. I'm having a lot of fun with it and you can tell someone put a lot of care into the setting and story. It's definitely worth the price they're asking as it's really well-crafted.

28288231.review: удивительно затягивающая игра, музыкальный фон, бэкграунды, герои, история - да просто очень круто всё =)

28286464.review:
Красивый пиксель-арт. Приятная музыка.
Загадочный мир со своей логикой, изучать которую интересно.
Интеграция геймпада тоже порадовала.
Долго ждал выхода игры и не разочаровался.
Однозначно советую приобщиться к игре, тем более цена крайне невелика

28286263.review:
Пока могу сказать только то, что загадки решать интересно. Что, какбэ, основополагающий фактор для пазла. Нужно играть.
Алсо, есть намёки на интересную историю.
Графен: пиксели и пиксели - не фанат, не разбираюсь..

28272615.review: A great, small puzzle platformer that does a fantastic job (for its size) of creating a sense of atmosphere.  There's more within than you're likely expecting for under $10 (3-4 hours of exploration, easy).  Well worth playing.  :)

28269425.review: Я джва года ждал эту игру!

28264289.review: Amazing pixel art and style. The puzzlevania concept is awesome, love coming across puzzles around the world!

28260589.review: Such a great game, think of toki tori in beautiful pixel art!

28260255.review: Интересный сюжет и необычные головолокми, паззл с большой буквы П. Игра, мир которой хочется исследовать чтобы докопаться до всех секретов.

28258023.review:
Замечательная красивая интересная непростая логическая игра с прекрасным интригующим и удивляющим сюжетом.
Мы с 5.8-летним сыном оба в восторге - играем вместе. Для сына эта игра стала серьёзным стимулом самостоятельно читать - диалоги в игре восхитительны.

Графика - настоящий правильный пиксель-арт, на который очень приятно смотреть. Каждый кадр выверен, выточен, вылизан. Анимации персонажей и всего вообще - очень качественные и живые.
Звук - классные ненавязчивые саундтреки, но с изюминкой. Я точно знаю, что над ними корпел композитор специально для этой игры!
Сюжет - милая нелинейная Стимпанк-сказка с хорошим концом (или концами?).
Управление - простое, удобное, рациональное, логичное. Клавиатура и геймпэд.

В совокупности всё это - достойнейшее произведение искусства. Да, на мой взгляд создатели игры относятся к результату своего труда как к произведению искусства! В отличии от многих современных игр, создающихся только ради выгоды.

Моё ревью - не ревью, а набор восторженных эпитетов по причине того, что не представляю как подробнее описать это произведение искусства, не раскрывая детали сюжета, т.е. без спойлеров.
